newsitem.title: USA: Checkers sees Q4 net loss from operations.
newsitem.headline: Checkers sees Q4 net loss from operations.

text.p: Checkers Drive-In Restaurants Inc said Friday it expected a net loss from operations of about $8.8 million for its fiscal fourth quarter, based on a preliminary review of results for the 16-week period ending December 30.
Soft sales, accompanied by a further deterioration in restaurant margins, have contributed to the fourth quarter loss, it said.
The company said the preliminary results did not include any possible fourth-quarter adjustments for such items as additional FAS-121 writedowns, restaurant closures, severances and relocations.
It said it had reduced the number of personnel at its Clearwaer corporate and modular manufacturing locations by about 20 percent as part of a management's program to reduce costs.
The company said it had promoted Joe Stein as chief financial officer in addition to his role as executive vice president and chief administrative officer.

Checkers also said it was continuing to work with CKE Restaurants Inc and other investors regarding their participation in the investment of some $20 million in Checkers through the purchase of Checkers stock in a previously announced private placement.
The placement is is expected to be completed within the next 30 days, it said.
Checkers Drive-In Restaurants Inc, along with its franchisees, operates about 500 double drive-thru restaurants primarily located in the Southeast.
